complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into creating the repository, setting up Turborepo, and verifying the setup.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: The task involves setting up a repository and configuring a monorepo structure, which is straightforward but requires attention to detail.

complexityAnalysis.description: Decomposes a goal into a series of sub-goals and task components, organizing tasks into a tree-like structure to understand the sequence, duration, and prerequisites of each subtask.
complexityAnalysis.use_case: Mapping out stages in constructing a building, from laying foundations to interior design.

complexityAnalysis.description: Examines the cognitive elements involved in tasks, such as decision-making, problem-solving, and mental processing, to reveal hidden aspects of task performance.
complexityAnalysis.use_case: Understanding decision-making processes in pilots training on a new aircraft.

complexityAnalysis.method: Goals, Operators, Methods, and Selection Rules (GOMS) Modeling
complexityAnalysis.description: Breaks down tasks into goals, identifies the behaviors (operators) used to achieve these goals, sequences of commonly occurring operators (methods), and the rules for selecting among competing methods.
complexityAnalysis.use_case: Evaluating user interface design and human-computer interaction.

complexityAnalysis.description: Measures the structural complexity of a software program by quantifying the number of linearly independent paths through the program's source code.
complexityAnalysis.use_case: Assessing the complexity of individual functions, modules, methods, or classes within a program.

complexityAnalysis.description: Estimates the computational complexity of an algorithm by assuming a probabilistic distribution of all possible inputs, used to design efficient algorithms or derive the complexity of known algorithms.
complexityAnalysis.use_case: Determining the average-case complexity of algorithms based on input distributions.

complexityAnalysis.description: Determines the time-averaged running time for a sequence of operations, providing a worst-case analysis for a sequence rather than an individual operation.
complexityAnalysis.use_case: Analyzing data structures like hash tables, disjoint sets, and splay trees.

complexityAnalysis.method: Best, Worst, and Average Case Analysis
complexityAnalysis.description: Evaluates the performance of an algorithm under the best, worst, and average conditions to understand its efficiency across different scenarios.
complexityAnalysis.use_case: Assessing sorting algorithms by analyzing their performance with sorted, reverse-sorted, and random input data.

complexityAnalysis.description: Decomposes complex problems recursively into smaller sub-problems, solves each sub-problem, and recombines the solutions to determine the overall solution.
complexityAnalysis.use_case: Implementing efficient sorting algorithms like Merge Sort and Quick Sort.

complexityAnalysis.description: Decomposes a complex problem into smaller, overlapping subproblems, solving each subproblem once and storing their solutions to avoid redundant computations.
complexityAnalysis.use_case: Solving optimization problems like the shortest path in a graph or the knapsack problem.

complexityAnalysis.description: Solves problems recursively by trying to build a solution incrementally, removing solutions that fail to satisfy the problem constraints as soon as possible.
complexityAnalysis.use_case: Solving puzzles like Sudoku or the N-Queens problem.
